* Main run method. Start the program by welcoming the user, then read user input, parse and process the
* input command. lastly exits the program when "bye" is inputted.
* ByeCommand class handle saving of data and showing bye message before the program exits.
* @param inData the user input that triggers this command.
* This function call storage.saveData() function to save TaskList into local file, then shows bye
* @param tasks TaskList object to be saved into local file.
* @param ui Ui object that manages showing of bye message.
* @param storage Storage object that manages saving of data to local file.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Command abstract class that encapsulates user's input into a command object.
* @param inData the user input that triggers this command.
* @param ui Ui object that manages user interactions.
* @param storage Storage object that manages local data access.
* @throws DukeException if there is error in user input.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException;
* This function indicates the exit status of the program. The program exits if the status is true.
* @return the exit status of the program.
* DeadlineCommand class contains helper functions for creating deadline task.

* @param ui Ui object that manages user interactions.
* @param storage Storage object that manages local data access.
* @throws DukeException if there is error in user input.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException {
ui.printIndented("Got it. I've added this task: ");
ui.printIndented("Now you have " + tasks.getTaskList().size() + " tasks in the list.");
* DeleteCommand class contains helper functions for deleting task.

* DoneCommand class contains helper functions for marking a task as done.

public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException {

* FindCommand class contains helper functions for finding task.
* @param inData the user input that triggers this command.
* This function find tasks that contains keyword given by the user input, and print out the find result.

public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException {
ui.printIndented("Result: No matching tasks in your list.");
ui.printIndented("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
* ListCommand class contains helper functions for listing all the tasks.

* DukeException class inherits Exception class and contains list of custom exceptions for Duke program.
protected final String unknownErrMsg = "☹ OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(\n";
protected final String inputEmptyErrMsg = "☹ OOPS!!! Input cannot be empty\n";
protected final String listEmptyErrMsg = "☹ OOPS!!! Your list is empty now.\n";
protected final String doneEmptyErrMsg = "☹ OOPS!!! Index for done cannot be empty.\n";
protected final String intExpectedErrMsg = "☹ OOPS!!! Index for <done> or <delete> should be an integer.\n";
protected final String indexOutOfBoundErrMsg = "☹ OOPS!!! Index out of bound.\n";
protected final String todoEmptyErrMsg = "☹ OOPS!!! <todo> cannot be empty.\n";
protected final String deadlineEmptyErrMsg = "☹ OOPS!!! <deadline> cannot be empty.\n";
protected final String deadlineFormatErrMsg = "☹ OOPS!!! <deadline> format incorrect.\n";
protected final String eventEmptyErrMsg = "☹ OOPS!!! <event> cannot be empty.\n";
protected final String eventFormatErrMsg = "☹ OOPS!!! <event> format incorrect.\n";
protected final String deleteEmptyErrMsg = "? OOPS!!! <delete> cannot be empty.\n";
protected final String findEmptyErrMsg = "☹ OOPS!!! <find> cannot be empty.\n";
protected final String defaultErrMsg = "☹ OOPS!!! error !\n";
